meanings.sent1: After the storm, the blacksmith had to retemper the sword to make it strong again.
meanings.sent2: The chef needed to retemper the chocolate to achieve the perfect consistency for the dessert.
meanings.sent3: The knight jokingly asked the blacksmith to retemper his armor so it could withstand dragon fire.
meanings.sent4: She decided to retemper her resolve, like steel in the forge, to face the challenges ahead.
meanings.sent5: The artist had to retemper the colors on his palette to capture the vibrant sunset hues.

meanings.definition: To restore or refresh the strength or spirit of.
meanings.sent1: A good night's sleep can retemper your energy for the next day.
meanings.sent2: The kind words of a friend can retemper your confidence when you are feeling down.
meanings.sent3: The funny movie helped retemper her mood after a long and tiring day at work.
meanings.sent4: Nature has a way of retempering our spirits, like a gentle breeze on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: The heartfelt song seemed to retemper the emotions of everyone in the room.
